com.microsoft.live

Class LiveAuthClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.live.LiveAuthClient

  • public class LiveAuthClient
extends java.lang.Object
    LiveAuthClient is a class responsible for retrieving a LiveConnectSession, which can be given to a LiveConnectClient in order to make requests to the Live Connect API.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LiveAuthClient(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String clientId)
      Constructs a new LiveAuthClient instance and initializes its member variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LiveAuthClient

        public LiveAuthClient(android.content.Context context,
                      java.lang.String clientId)
        Constructs a new LiveAuthClient instance and initializes its member variables.
        Parameters:
        context - Context of the Application used to save any refresh_token.
        clientId - The client_id of the Live Connect Application to login to.

    • Method Detail

      • getClientId

        public java.lang.String getClientId()
        Returns:
        the client_id of the Live Connect application.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> scopes,
                       LiveAuthListener listener)
        Initializes a new LiveConnectSession with the given scopes. The LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread. If the wl.offline_access scope is used, a refresh_token is stored in the given Activity's SharedPerfences.
        Parameters:
        scopes - to initialize the LiveConnectSession with. See MSDN Live Connect Reference's Scopes and permissions for a list of scopes and explanations.
        listener - called on either completion or error during the initialize process.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> scopes,
                       LiveAuthListener listener,
                       java.lang.Object userState)
        Initializes a new LiveConnectSession with the given scopes. The LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread. If the wl.offline_access scope is used, a refresh_token is stored in the given Activity's SharedPerfences.
        Parameters:
        scopes - to initialize the LiveConnectSession with. See MSDN Live Connect Reference's Scopes and permissions for a list of scopes and explanations.
        listener - called on either completion or error during the initialize process
        userState - arbitrary object that is used to determine the caller of the method.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> scopes,
                       LiveAuthListener listener,
                       java.lang.Object userState,
                       java.lang.String refreshToken)
        Initializes a new LiveConnectSession with the given scopes. The LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread. If the wl.offline_access scope is used, a refresh_token is stored in the given Activity's SharedPerfences.
        Parameters:
        scopes - to initialize the LiveConnectSession with. See MSDN Live Connect Reference's Scopes and permissions for a list of scopes and explanations.
        listener - called on either completion or error during the initialize process
        userState - arbitrary object that is used to determine the caller of the method.
        refreshToken - optional previously saved token to be used by this client.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(LiveAuthListener listener)
        Initializes a new LiveConnectSession with the given scopes. The LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread. If the wl.offline_access scope is used, a refresh_token is stored in the given Activity's SharedPerfences. This initialize will use the last successfully used scopes from either a login or initialize.
        Parameters:
        listener - called on either completion or error during the initialize process.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(LiveAuthListener listener,
                       java.lang.Object userState)
        Initializes a new LiveConnectSession with the given scopes. The LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread. If the wl.offline_access scope is used, a refresh_token is stored in the given Activity's SharedPerfences. This initialize will use the last successfully used scopes from either a login or initialize.
        Parameters:
        listener - called on either completion or error during the initialize process.
        userState - arbitrary object that is used to determine the caller of the method.

      • login

        public void login(android.app.Activity activity,
                  java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> scopes,
                  LiveAuthListener listener)
        Logs in an user with the given scopes. login displays a Dialog that will prompt the user for a username and password, and ask for consent to use the given scopes. A LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity instance to display the Login dialog on.
        scopes - to initialize the LiveConnectSession with. See MSDN Live Connect Reference's Scopes and permissions for a list of scopes and explanations.
        listener - called on either completion or error during the login process.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is a pending login request.

      • login

        public void login(android.app.Activity activity,
                  java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> scopes,
                  LiveAuthListener listener,
                  java.lang.Object userState)
        Logs in an user with the given scopes. login displays a Dialog that will prompt the user for a username and password, and ask for consent to use the given scopes. A LiveConnectSession will be returned by calling LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object). Otherwise, the LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called. These methods will be called on the main/UI thread.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity instance to display the Login dialog on
        scopes - to initialize the LiveConnectSession with. See MSDN Live Connect Reference's Scopes and permissions for a list of scopes and explanations.
        listener - called on either completion or error during the login process.
        userState - arbitrary object that is used to determine the caller of the method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is a pending login request.

      • logout

        public void logout(LiveAuthListener listener)
        Logs out the given user. Also, this method clears the previously created LiveConnectSession. LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object) will be called on completion. Otherwise, LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called.
        Parameters:
        listener - called on either completion or error during the logout process.

      • logout

        public void logout(LiveAuthListener listener,
                   java.lang.Object userState)
        Logs out the given user. Also, this method clears the previously created LiveConnectSession. LiveAuthListener.onAuthComplete(LiveStatus, LiveConnectSession, Object) will be called on completion. Otherwise, LiveAuthListener.onAuthError(LiveAuthException, Object) will be called.
        Parameters:
        listener - called on either completion or error during the logout process.
        userState - arbitrary object that is used to determine the caller of the method.
